events.description: End of the most recent Ice Age.

events.details: A bison on the ceiling of the Altamira Cave.

events.description: Humans are eating lentils, vetch and pistachios.

events.location: Levant (Syria, Israel, Palestine, Lebanon, Jordan, Cyprus, Turkey)
events.description: Cultivation of emmer and einkorn wheat, barley, peas, lentils, bitter vetch, chickpeas, and flax.

events.details: The excavation site at Göbekli Tepe.

events.description: The settlement now consists of 70 dwellings, a stone wall, and a tower.
events.details: A view of the remains of the earliest wall/tower at Jericho.

events.description: Farmers build a permanent agrarian settlement with mud-brick buildings for agricultural storage.

events.details: A German bow used by the Holmegaard culture that dates to 9000 BCE.

events.description: Domestication of sheep in several locations in central and southwest Asia.
First evidence of metalworking with a copper pendant.
Agriculture is well-established along the banks of the Nile.
Domestication of pigs in the Near East, China, and Germany.
Dwellers have domesticated emmer wheat, barley, sheep, and goats.

events.details: A view of the archaeological excavations at Çatalhöyük. Woven linen cloth is being made.

events.description: Domestication of cattle in North Africa, India, and Mesopotamia.
Domestication of chickens in India and Southeast Asia.
The Seated Woman of Çatal Hüyük figurine is made.
events.details: The head and right arm rest are restorations.
